channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syrian Rebels Celebrate Capture of Hama
item.description: Syrian rebels took the city of Hama on Thursday, before continuing to push south in a march toward Homs, a major city, and Damascus, the capital.

item.title: Agriculture Department to Require Testing of U.S. Milk Supply for Bird Flu Virus
item.description: The new rules call for testing unpasteurized milk from dairies across the country and for farm owners to provide details that would help officials ide...

item.title: Federal Judge Upholds Racial Preferences in Naval Academy Admissions
item.description: A group that won a Supreme Court case challenging affirmative action at Harvard and the University of North Carolina had also sued the military academ...

item.title: Boeing’s plea deal shot down by judge because the independent monitor would be a DEI hire
item.description: The scandal-plagued aerospace group has 30 days to come up with a new plan with the Justice Department.

item.title: Billy Long Promised Huge Tax Refunds. Now Trump Wants Him to Lead the I.R.S.
item.description: Since leaving Congress in 2023, Billy Long has peddled a pandemic-era tax credit that the I.R.S. has warned is a magnet for fraud.

item.title: Syrian Rebels Push South, Despite Efforts to Slow Them
item.description: Government forces appeared to be reinforcing crucial strongholds including the capital, Damascus, and the major city of Homs.

item.title: Slain UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson’s tenure was marked by rocketing profits—and accusations of insider trading and coverage denial
item.description: Following Thompson’s death, social media erupted with grievances about the health care giant and private insurers in the U.S.

item.title: Jury in Daniel Penny’s Trial Struggles to Agree on Manslaughter Charge in Choking Case
item.description: It was unclear whether the case would result in a mistrial or if jurors would be able to consider the second charge against Daniel Penny in the killin...

item.title: Super Micro just hired a new auditor that might save it from getting the boot from Nasdaq
item.description: The Nvidia-adjacent server maker hired BDO USA after its former auditor quit because it couldn’t trust the management team or the board of directors.

item.title: Their Fertilizer Poisons Farmland. Now, They Want Protection From Lawsuits.
item.description: A company controlled by Goldman Sachs is helping to lead a lobbying effort by makers of fertilizer linked to “forever chemicals.”

item.title: Syrian Rebels Push South, Despite Efforts to Slow Them
item.description: Government forces appeared to be reinforcing crucial strongholds including the capital, Damascus, and the major city of Homs.

item.title: Kim Kardashian posts video testing Tesla Optimus AI robot and Cybercab: ‘There’s no driver?’
item.description: Kardashian posted a video playing rock-paper-scissors with Optimus, a human-sized AI robot that Musk has promised “can babysit your kids” or help arou...

item.title: As India-Bangladesh Tensions Rise, So Do Fears of Tit-for-Tat Violence
item.description: A diplomatic dispute over claims of persecution of Bangladeshi Hindus threatens to upend Bangladesh’s interim government.

item.title: Tesla jumps as Elon Musk’s ‘bet for the ages’ on Trump is seen paying off with federal self-driving rules
item.description: Tesla stock jumped after a report said Trump's transition team is prioritizing the creation of federal framework for fully autonomous cars.

item.title: Israeli Attacks Around Kamal Adwan Hospital in Gaza Kill Scores, Doctors Say
item.description: Airstrikes, gunfire, panic and orders to evacuate in the dark of night combined to cause heavy casualties in the area of Kamal Adwan, one of the last ...
